intro: Cantuffa subvestita, commonly known as the velvet-leafed cantuffa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Its unique foliage and floral structure make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
